solution.text:
Given that:
Area of \(\Delta ABC\) = _{j}_ sq.units,
Area of \(\Delta PQR\) = _{i}_ sq.units,
And AC = _{k}_ units
By Theorem 6.6, we have,
\(Area(\Delta ABC)\over Area(\Delta PQR)\) = \(AC^2\over PR^2\)
i.e., \(_{j}_\over _{i}_\) = \(_{k}_^2\over PR^2\)
i.e., \(PR^2 = {{_{{k*k}}_\times _{i}_}\over _{j}_}\)
i.e., \(PR^2 = _{{trunc(Decimal(k)*k*i/j,2)}}_\)
i.e., \(PR = \sqrt{_{{trunc(Decimal(k)*k*i/j,2)}}_}\)
i.e., \(PR = {_{{trunc(pow((k*k*i/j),Decimal(0.5)),2)}}_}\)

content.text:
Areas of two similar triangle, \(\Delta ABC\) and \(\Delta PQR\) are given as _{j}_ sq.units and _{i}_ sq. units respectively.
If AC = _{k}_ units, find PR.
